title: Nosh.bio: Harnessing fermentation to make sustainable nutrition affordable for everyone
text: Nosh.bio: Harnessing fermentation to make sustainable nutrition affordable for everyone German start-up Nosh.bio uses fermentation to produce sustainable and scalable proteins, notably mycelium. The company is on track to reach a mycelium protein production capacity of thousands of tons per year using the infrastructure of an old brewery. The company uses a fermentation process can be tailored to produce ingredients for alt-meat, as well as confectionery, sauces and wellness products. CEO Tim Fronzek tells us more.
